body:
Is there a lot of output which locks the browser up every time you try to open it? If so, try installing and running [nbstripout](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/nbstripout) on it. That should remove the output but leave your code and markdown in there.

If you need to keep other bits of the output, you might be able to read the file with the [nbformat module](http://nbformat.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html) and selectively remove the bits you don't need, then write it back to another file.

Yes there is! I was testing a function that returns a lot of input!
Is it easy to install and run such thing? I am not a very experienced
jupyter notebook user, i was wondering if you could give some guidelines.

Thank you very much for your attention!
Pedro Osório

2017-12-08 14:28 GMT+00:00 Thomas Kluyver <notifications@github.com>:

> open it? If so, try installing and running nbstripout
> <https://pypi.python.org/pypi/nbstripout> on it. That should remove the
> output but leave your code and markdown in there.
>
> If you need to keep other bits of the output, you might be able to read
> the file with the nbformat module
> <http://nbformat.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html> and selectively
> remove the bits you don't need, then write it back to another file.
>

> .
>

I am really kind of desperate since all my work is in that notebook and i
have to share it with my teacher tomorrow!
I don't want to bother you anymore with my troubles, but I was wondering
whether i could share my notebook with you, and then you would help me
clear all the output. I would be so thankful!

Thank you again!
Pedro Osório

> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/Agx-_e10udYU9MDTQg3hSCy0mSGA_vftks5s-Ud5gaJpZM4Q7FNP>

It should be easy. In a terminal or command prompt, run "pip install
nbstripout" to install it, and then "nbstripout mynotebook.ipynb" (using
the file path of your notebook) to clear the output.

I'm about to go to bed, so it's probably not a good idea to rely on me!
